definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The one hundred and first meridian was passed.
sentences.chinese: 現在已經越過了經線一百零一度了。

sentences.english: The ventral nerve cord is covered externally by a peritoneum.
The weavers had learned to set their looms so that the cotton warps were on two different levels.
sentences.chinese: 織工會設置織機，使棉經線於不同水平面上。

sentences.english: Each row of holes punched in the cards corresponds to one row of thread in the design.
sentences.chinese: 打在卡片上的每一排孔對應設計的一排經線。

sentences.english: This kind of pressure stimulates the nerve pathways in the pelvis.
sentences.chinese: 這種擠壓刺激盆骨裏德神經線。

sentences.english: Lines of longitude converge as they approach the poles.
sentences.chinese: 經線在靠近兩極時逐漸靠近，最終匯聚在一起。

sentences.english: The map even includes lines of latitude and longitude.
sentences.chinese: 這張地圖甚至包含了經線和緯線。

sentences.english: Heddles will be bound between another horizontal bar and warps.
sentences.chinese: 綜線將被纏繞在另一個橫木和經線之間。

sentences.english: The problem was not solved completely until the invention of the marine chronometer in the eighteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題直到十八世紀發明了航海經線儀才得以解決。

sentences.english: What interested her most was the longitude line.
sentences.chinese: 她最感興趣的是那條經線。

sentences.english: He replied that lines of longitude don't cross the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 他推說這條經線沒有經過海洋。

definition: to help a mother give birth
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
to form a picture/to develop a photo/to visualize
